page.title: 05HOLY TRINITY CHURCH
page.content: The Rector, Rev R Moorsom kindly took us on a tour of the Church. This is the second Anglican Church built in Lulworth.The first,built in Norman times,was pulled down in 1869 and the stone used to build the new one on a different site in 1870."Early Geometrical Gothic",it was built to seat 300 and there are painted texts over the nave arches.The font and pulpit are made of Purbeck stone and the lectern is carved in the shape of an eagle. Of particular interest, is the Communion Table made from the beams of the old church, behind this is a beautiful wooden screen brought from OBERAMMERGAU in Germany.It has 4 carved panels depicting, The Nativity of Jesus, His Baptism,The Crucifixion and the Breaking of Bread after the walk to Emmaus.
